## Complexity Assessment Complete

I've analyzed the task and created `complexity_assessment.json` with the following determination:

### **Complexity: STANDARD**

**Reasoning**: This is a new page implementation with three custom UI components (progress ring, timeline, tabs). While it will touch multiple files (~9), there are:
- ✅ No external service integrations
- ✅ No infrastructure changes
- ✅ No unfamiliar technologies
- ✅ Research limited to internal codebase patterns

### Key Analysis Points

**Scope**: 
- ~9 files (page component, 3 child components, routing, styles, data layer)
- Single service (frontend)
- Contained to this new page, not cross-cutting

**Risk Level**: Low
- New page with no impact on existing functionality
- Main concerns: matching design spec and data integration

**Validation**: Medium depth
- Unit tests for component logic
- Integration tests for page rendering
- No security scan needed (no auth/sensitive code)

### Recommended Pipeline

```
discovery → requirements → context → spec_writing → planning → validation
```

This is the standard 6-phase pipeline without the research phase (no external APIs to learn) or self-critique phase (not complex enough to warrant it).

The orchestrator can now proceed with the discovery phase to locate the design spec (`15-project-overview.png`) and understand existing component patterns.
I'll start by reading all the input files to gather the necessary context for creating the spec.

1→'use client'
     2→
     3→import { useState, useEffect, useMemo, useCallback } from 'react'
     4→import { useRouter } from 'next/navigation'
     5→import Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     6→import Skeleton from '@mui/material/Skeleton'
     7→import { apiClient } from '@/lib/api/client'
     8→import { ProjectContext } from '@/lib/contexts/ProjectContext'
     9→import { AuthContext } from '@/lib/contexts/AuthContext'
    10→
    11→interface User {
    12→  id: string
    13→  email: string
    14→  fullName: string
    15→  role?: string
    16→}
    17→
    18→interface Project {
    19→  id: string
    20→  name: string
    21→  code: string
    22→  description?: string
    23→}
    24→
    25→export default function DashboardLayout({
    26→  children,
    27→}: {
    28→  children: React.ReactNode
    29→}) {
    30→  const router = useRouter()
    31→  const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null)
    32→  const [projects, setProjects] = useState<Project[]>([])
    33→  const [selectedProjectId, setSelectedProjectId] = useState<string | null>(null)
    34→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    35→
    36→  useEffect(() => {
    37→    const loadUserAndProjects = async () => {
    38→      try {
    39→        const token = localStorage.getItem('authToken')
    40→        if (!token) {
    41→          router.push('/login')
    42→          return
    43→        }
    44→
    45→        const [userResponse, projectsResponse] = await Promise.all([
    46→          apiClient.get('/auth/me'),
    47→          apiClient.get('/projects'),
    48→        ])
    49→
    50→        setUser({
    51→          id: userResponse.data.id,
    52→          email: userResponse.data.email,
    53→          fullName: userResponse.data.fullName || '',
    54→          role: userResponse.data.role,
    55→        })
    56→
    57→        const projectsList = projectsResponse.data || []
    58→        setProjects(projectsList)
    59→
    60→        const savedProjectId = localStorage.getItem('selectedProjectId')
    61→        if (savedProjectId && projectsList.some((p: Project) => p.id === savedProjectId)) {
    62→          setSelectedProjectId(savedProjectId)
    63→        } else if (projectsList.length > 0) {
    64→          setSelectedProjectId(projectsList[0].id)
    65→        }
    66→      } catch (error) {
    67→        console.error('Failed to load user data:', error)
    68→        router.push('/login')
    69→      } finally {
    70→        setLoading(false)
    71→      }
    72→    }
    73→
    74→    loadUserAndProjects()
    75→  }, [router])
    76→
    77→  const handleProjectChange = useCallback((projectId: string | null) => {
    78→    setSelectedProjectId(projectId)
    79→    if (projectId) {
    80→      localStorage.setItem('selectedProjectId', projectId)
    81→    } else {
    82→      localStorage.removeItem('selectedProjectId')
    83→    }
    84→  }, [])
    85→
    86→  const logout = useCallback(() => {
    87→    localStorage.removeItem('authToken')
    88→    localStorage.removeItem('userId')
    89→    localStorage.removeItem('selectedProjectId')
    90→    document.cookie = 'authToken=; path=/; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT'
    91→    router.push('/login')
    92→  }, [router])
    93→
    94→  const currentProject = useMemo(
    95→    () => projects.find((p) => p.id === selectedProjectId) || null,
    96→    [projects, selectedProjectId]
    97→  )
    98→
    99→  const projectContextValue = useMemo(
   100→    () => ({
   101→      selectedProjectId,
   102→      setSelectedProjectId: handleProjectChange,
   103→      projects,
   104→      currentProject,
   105→    }),
   106→    [selectedProjectId, handleProjectChange, projects, currentProject]
   107→  )
   108→
   109→  const authContextValue = useMemo(
   110→    () => ({
   111→      user,
   112→      logout,
   113→    }),
   114→    [user, logout]
   115→  )
   116→
   117→  if (loading) {
   118→    return (
   119→      <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', minHeight: '100vh' }}>
   120→        <Box sx={{ width: 260, bgcolor: 'background.paper', borderRight: 1, borderColor: 'divider' }}>
   121→          <Box sx={{ p: 2.5 }}>
   122→            <Skeleton variant="rounded" width={200} height={40} />
   123→          </Box>
   124→          <Box sx={{ px: 1.5 }}>
   125→            {[...Array(8)].map((_, i) => (
   126→              <Skeleton key={i} variant="rounded" height={40} sx={{ mb: 1 }} />
   127→            ))}
   128→          </Box>
   129→        </Box>
   130→        <Box sx={{ flex: 1 }}>
   131→          <Box sx={{ height: 64, borderBottom: 1, borderColor: 'divider', px: 3, display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}>
   132→            <Skeleton variant="rounded" width={200} height={40} />
   133→          </Box>
   134→          <Box sx={{ p: 3 }}>
   135→            <Skeleton variant="text" width={300} height={48} sx={{ mb: 2 }} />
   136→            <Box sx={{ display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(4, 1fr)', gap: 3 }}>
   137→              {[...Array(4)].map((_, i) => (
   138→                <Skeleton key={i} variant="rounded" height={140} />
   139→              ))}
   140→            </Box>
   141→          </Box>
   142→        </Box>
   143→      </Box>
   144→    )
   145→  }
   146→
   147→  return (
   148→    <AuthContext.Provider value={authContextValue}>
   149→      <ProjectContext.Provider value={projectContextValue}>
   150→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', minHeight: '100vh' }}>
   151→          {children}
   152→        </Box>
   153→      </ProjectContext.Provider>
   154→    </AuthContext.Provider>
   155→  )
   156→}
   157→

1→import { Box, Typography, LinearProgress } from '@mui/material'
     2→import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3→
     4→interface ProgressBarProps {
     5→  value: number
     6→  label?: string
     7→  showValue?: boolean
     8→  size?: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large'
     9→  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    10→  variant?: 'determinate' | 'indeterminate'
    11→}
    12→
    13→const StyledLinearProgress = styled(LinearProgress, {
    14→  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'barSize',
    15→})<{ barSize: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' }>(({ theme, barSize }) => ({
    16→  borderRadius: 4,
    17→  height: barSize === 'small' ? 4 : barSize === 'medium' ? 8 : 12,
    18→  backgroundColor: theme.palette.mode === 'dark' ? theme.palette.grey[800] : theme.palette.grey[200],
    19→  '& .MuiLinearProgress-bar': {
    20→    borderRadius: 4,
    21→    // RTL-safe: MUI LinearProgress automatically fills from correct direction based on theme.direction
    22→  },
    23→}))
    24→
    25→export function ProgressBar({
    26→  value,
    27→  label,
    28→  showValue = true,
    29→  size = 'medium',
    30→  color = 'primary',
    31→  variant = 'determinate',
    32→}: ProgressBarProps) {
    33→  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    34→
    35→  return (
    36→    <Box sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    37→      {(label || showValue) && (
    38→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'space-between', mb: 0.5 }}>
    39→          {label && (
    40→            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={500}>
    41→              {label}
    42→            </Typography>
    43→          )}
    44→          {showValue && variant === 'determinate' && (
    45→            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={600}>
    46→              {normalizedValue}%
    47→            </Typography>
    48→          )}
    49→        </Box>
    50→      )}
    51→      <StyledLinearProgress
    52→        variant={variant}
    53→        value={normalizedValue}
    54→        color={color}
    55→        barSize={size}
    56→      />
    57→    </Box>
    58→  )
    59→}
    60→
    61→interface CircularProgressDisplayProps {
    62→  value: number
    63→  size?: number
    64→  thickness?: number
    65→  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    66→  showLabel?: boolean
    67→}
    68→
    69→export function CircularProgressDisplay({
    70→  value,
    71→  size = 80,
    72→  thickness = 4,
    73→  color = 'primary',
    74→  showLabel = true,
    75→}: CircularProgressDisplayProps) {
    76→  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    77→
    78→  return (
    79→    <Box sx={{ position: 'relative', display: 'inline-flex' }}>
    80→      <Box
    81→        sx={{
    82→          position: 'relative',
    83→          width: size,
    84→          height: size,
    85→        }}
    86→      >
    87→        <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" style={{ transform: 'rotate(-90deg)' }}>
    88→          <circle
    89→            cx="50"
    90→            cy="50"
    91→            r={50 - thickness}
    92→            fill="none"
    93→            stroke="currentColor"
    94→            strokeWidth={thickness}
    95→            style={{ opacity: 0.2 }}
    96→          />
    97→          <circle
    98→            cx="50"
    99→            cy="50"
   100→            r={50 - thickness}
   101→            fill="none"
   102→            stroke="currentColor"
   103→            strokeWidth={thickness}
   104→            strokeLinecap="round"
   105→            strokeDasharray={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness)}`}
   106→            strokeDashoffset={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness) * (1 - normalizedValue / 100)}`}
   107→            style={{
   108→              transition: 'stroke-dashoffset 500ms ease-out',
   109→              color: `var(--mui-palette-${color}-main)`,
   110→            }}
   111→          />
   112→        </svg>
   113→      </Box>
   114→      {showLabel && (
   115→        <Box
   116→          sx={{
   117→            position: 'absolute',
   118→            top: 0,
   119→            insetInlineStart: 0,
   120→            bottom: 0,
   121→            insetInlineEnd: 0,
   122→            display: 'flex',
   123→            alignItems: 'center',
   124→            justifyContent: 'center',
   125→          }}
   126→        >
   127→          <Typography variant="h6" fontWeight={700} color={`${color}.main`}>
   128→            {normalizedValue}%
   129→          </Typography>
   130→        </Box>
   131→      )}
   132→    </Box>
   133→  )
   134→}

   124→@router.get("/project-trends", response_model=ProjectTrendsResponse)
   125→async def get_project_trends(
   126→    start_date: str = Query(None, description="Start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)"),
   127→    end_date: str = Query(None, description="End date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)"),
   128→    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db),
   129→    current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)
   130→):
   131→    """Get time series data for project trends (line/bar chart)"""
   132→
   133→    # Default to last 30 days if no dates provided
   134→    if not end_date:
   135→        end_datetime = datetime.utcnow()
   136→    else:
   137→        end_datetime = datetime.fromisoformat(end_date)
   138→
   139→    if not start_date:
   140→        start_datetime = end_datetime - timedelta(days=30)
   141→    else:
   142→        start_datetime = datetime.fromisoformat(start_date)
   143→
   144→    # Generate daily data points
   145→    data_points = []
   146→    current_date = start_datetime
   147→
   148→    while current_date <= end_datetime:
   149→        next_date = current_date + timedelta(days=1)
   150→
   151→        # Count inspections created on this day
   152→        inspection_count = await db.execute(
   153→            select(func.count())
   154→            .select_from(Inspection)
   155→            .where(Inspection.created_at >= current_date)
   156→            .where(Inspection.created_at < next_date)
   157→        )
   158→        inspections = inspection_count.scalar() or 0
   159→
   160→        # Count equipment submissions on this day
   161→        equipment_count = await db.execute(
   162→            select(func.count())
   163→            .select_from(Equipment)
   164→            .where(Equipment.created_at >= current_date)
   165→            .where(Equipment.created_at < next_date)
   166→        )
   167→        equipment_submissions = equipment_count.scalar() or 0
   168→
   169→        # Count material submissions on this day
   170→        material_count = await db.execute(
   171→            select(func.count())
   172→            .select_from(Material)
   173→            .where(Material.created_at >= current_date)
   174→            .where(Material.created_at < next_date)
   175→        )
   176→        material_submissions = material_count.scalar() or 0
   177→
   178→        data_points.append(TrendDataPoint(
   179→            date=current_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
   180→            inspections=inspections,
   181→            equipment_submissions=equipment_submissions,
   182→            material_submissions=material_submissions
   183→        ))
   184→
   185→        current_date = next_date
   186→
   187→    return ProjectTrendsResponse(data_points=data_points)
   188→

entries.content:
Perfect! I have successfully completed the planning phase for the Project Overview Page feature. Let me provide you with a summary of what has been created:

## 📋 Planning Session Complete

### Files Created/Updated:

1. **implementation_plan.json** ✅
   - 4 phases with 9 subtasks
   - Backend API → Frontend Components → Frontend Page → Integration
   - Sequential workflow (each phase depends on previous)
   - Estimated duration: 4-6 hours

2. **context.json** ✅
   - Files to create: 4 frontend components, 1 backend schema
   - Files to modify: 1 backend API file
   - Reference files identified: Dashboard patterns, existing components
   - Key insight: Can reuse CircularProgressDisplay and Tabs components

3. **project_index.json** ✅
   - Updated to reflect Next.js (was incorrectly showing Vite)
   - Confirmed tech stack: Next.js 14, Material-UI, FastAPI, PostgreSQL

4. **init.sh** ✅
   - Environment setup script (executable)
   - Starts backend (port 8000) and frontend (port 3000)
   - Includes dependency checks and wait-for-service logic

5. **build-progress.txt** ✅
   - Complete progress tracking document
   - Includes startup commands and next steps

### Implementation Plan Summary:

**Phase 1: Backend API** (2 subtasks)
- Create ProjectOverview schema
- Add GET /projects/{id}/overview endpoint

**Phase 2: Frontend Components** (3 subtasks)
- ProjectProgressRing component (reuses CircularProgressDisplay)
- ProjectTimeline component (new, vertical timeline)
- ProjectOverviewTabs component (wraps existing Tabs)

**Phase 3: Frontend Page** (2 subtasks)
- Create /projects/[id]/overview route
- Integrate all components with data flow

**Phase 4: Integration** (2 subtasks)
- Cross-browser and responsive verification
- End-to-end flow testing

### Key Findings from Investigation:

✅ **Design reference located**: `design-assets/project/15-project-overview.png`  
✅ **Reusable components found**: CircularProgressDisplay, Tabs, TabPanel  
✅ **API patterns identified**: Analytics and Projects endpoints as references  
✅ **Tech stack confirmed**: Next.js App Router, Material-UI, TypeScript, FastAPI  
✅ **No new dependencies needed**: Everything uses existing libraries

### Parallelism Analysis:

- **Recommended workers**: 1 (sequential execution required)
- **Max parallel phases**: 1
- **Reason**: Each phase depends on the previous phase completing
- Phase dependencies: 1 → 2 → 3 → 4

### Next Steps:

**To continue implementation, run:**
```bash
source auto-claude/.venv/bin/activate && python auto-claude/run.py --spec 058 --parallel 1
```

**Or start services manually:**
```bash
./auto-claude/specs/058-create-project-overview-page/init.sh
```

---

## 🛑 Planning Complete - Implementation Ready

My planning work is complete. The next session (coder agent) will:
1. Read the implementation_plan.json
2. Start with Phase 1, Subtask 1-1 (Create ProjectOverview schema)
3. Follow the sequential phases until completion

**Note**: All planning files are gitignored and stay local. Only actual code changes will be committed by the coder agent.
I'll help you create the ProjectOverview response schema. Let me start by verifying my current directory and reading the pattern files to understand the code style.

1→from __future__ import annotations
     2→
     3→import re
     4→from typing import Annotated, Optional
     5→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, ConfigDict
     6→from pydantic.functional_validators import BeforeValidator
     7→from pydantic.alias_generators import to_camel
     8→
     9→MIN_NAME_LENGTH = 2
    10→MAX_NAME_LENGTH = 255
    11→MAX_CODE_LENGTH = 50
    12→MAX_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH = 2000
    13→MAX_NOTES_LENGTH = 5000
    14→MAX_PHONE_LENGTH = 30
    15→MAX_ADDRESS_LENGTH = 500
    16→
    17→DANGEROUS_PATTERNS = [
    18→    r'<script[^>]*>.*?</script>',
    19→    r'javascript:',
    20→    r'on\w+\s*=',
    21→    r'<iframe[^>]*>',
    22→    r'<img[^>]*>',
    23→    r'<svg[^>]*>.*?</svg>',
    24→    r'<object[^>]*>',
    25→    r'<embed[^>]*>',
    26→    r'<link[^>]*>',
    27→    r'<meta[^>]*>',
    28→    r'<style[^>]*>.*?</style>',
    29→]
    30→
    31→
    32→def sanitize_string(value: Optional[str]) -> Optional[str]:
    33→    if value is None:
    34→        return None
    35→    value = value.strip()
    36→    for pattern in DANGEROUS_PATTERNS:
    37→        value = re.sub(pattern, '', value, flags=re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)
    38→    return value
    39→
    40→
    41→def validate_code(value: str) -> str:
    42→    value = value.strip().upper()
    43→    if not re.match(r'^[A-Z0-9][A-Z0-9\-_]{0,48}[A-Z0-9]?$', value):
    44→        raise ValueError('Code must contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores')
    45→    return value
    46→
    47→
    48→def validate_phone(value: Optional[str]) -> Optional[str]:
    49→    if value is None:
    50→        return None
    51→    value = value.strip()
    52→    if value and not re.match(r'^[\d\s\-\+\(\)\.]+$', value):
    53→        raise ValueError('Phone must contain only digits, spaces, and standard phone characters')
    54→    return value
    55→
    56→
    57→SanitizedStr = Annotated[str, BeforeValidator(sanitize_string)]
    58→SanitizedStrOptional = Annotated[Optional[str], BeforeValidator(sanitize_string)]
    59→CodeStr = Annotated[str, BeforeValidator(validate_code)]
    60→PhoneStr = Annotated[Optional[str], BeforeValidator(validate_phone)]
    61→
    62→NameField = Annotated[str, Field(min_length=MIN_NAME_LENGTH, max_length=MAX_NAME_LENGTH)]
    63→CodeField = Annotated[str, Field(min_length=2, max_length=MAX_CODE_LENGTH)]
    64→DescriptionField = Annotated[str | None, Field(max_length=MAX_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH)]
    65→NotesField = Annotated[str | None, Field(max_length=MAX_NOTES_LENGTH)]
    66→AddressField = Annotated[str | None, Field(max_length=MAX_ADDRESS_LENGTH)]
    67→PhoneField = Annotated[str | None, Field(max_length=MAX_PHONE_LENGTH)]
    68→ShortTextField = Annotated[str | None, Field(max_length=MAX_NAME_LENGTH)]
    69→
    70→
    71→class CamelCaseModel(BaseModel):
    72→    model_config = ConfigDict(
    73→        from_attributes=True,
    74→        alias_generator=to_camel,
    75→        populate_by_name=True,
    76→    )

from __future__ import annotations

from uuid import UUID
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Optional
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
from app.core.validators import CamelCaseModel


class TimelineEvent(CamelCaseModel):
    """Timeline event for project activity history"""
    id: UUID
    date: datetime
    title: str
    description: Optional[str] = None
    event_type: str = Field(description="Type of event: inspection, milestone, equipment, material, meeting, etc.")
    entity_id: Optional[UUID] = None
    entity_type: Optional[str] = None
    user_name: Optional[str] = None
    metadata: Optional[dict] = None

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 1-1 Complete: Create ProjectOverview Response Schema

I've successfully completed the first subtask of the Project Overview Page feature. Here's what was accomplished:

### Created File
**`backend/app/schemas/project_overview.py`** - A comprehensive schema module with 5 Pydantic models:

1. **`TimelineEvent`** - Captures project activity history with date, title, description, event type, and metadata
2. **`ProgressMetrics`** - Tracks completion across inspections, equipment, materials, and checklists with percentage calculation
3. **`TeamStats`** - Provides team member counts and role distribution
4. **`ProjectStats`** - Aggregates key metrics like inspections, equipment, materials, meetings, findings, and timeline data
5. **`ProjectOverviewResponse`** - Main response schema that combines all the above into a complete project overview

### Key Features
- ✅ All schemas inherit from `CamelCaseModel` for proper API serialization (camelCase output)
- ✅ Proper type hints with `Optional` for nullable fields
- ✅ Field validation with Pydantic `Field()` including descriptions and constraints (ge=0, le=100)
- ✅ Follows established patterns from `project.py` and `inspection.py`
- ✅ Uses `from __future__ import annotations` for forward references

### Verification
- ✅ Python syntax validation passed
- ✅ AST parsing successful  
- ✅ All required classes present (ProjectOverviewResponse, TimelineEvent, ProgressMetrics)
- ✅ Clean commit: `9f2146e`

### Status
- **Implementation Plan**: Updated to `"status": "completed"`
- **Build Progress**: Documented completion in build-progress.txt

    10→class TimelineEvent(CamelCaseModel):
    11→    """Timeline event for project activity history"""
    12→    id: UUID
    13→    date: datetime
    14→    title: str
    15→    description: Optional[str] = None
    16→    event_type: str = Field(description="Type of event: inspection, milestone, equipment, material, meeting, etc.")
    17→    entity_id: Optional[UUID] = None
    18→    entity_type: Optional[str] = None
    19→    user_name: Optional[str] = None
    20→    metadata: Optional[dict] = None
    21→
    22→
    23→class ProgressMetrics(CamelCaseModel):
    24→    """Progress metrics for project completion tracking"""
    25→    overall_percentage: float = Field(ge=0, le=100, description="Overall project completion percentage")
    26→    inspections_completed: int = Field(ge=0)
    27→    inspections_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    28→    equipment_submitted: int = Field(ge=0)
    29→    equipment_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    30→    materials_submitted: int = Field(ge=0)
    31→    materials_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    32→    checklists_completed: int = Field(ge=0)
    33→    checklists_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    34→
    35→
    36→class TeamStats(CamelCaseModel):
    37→    """Team statistics for project overview"""
    38→    total_members: int = Field(ge=0)
    39→    active_members: int = Field(ge=0)
    40→    roles: dict[str, int] = Field(default_factory=dict, description="Count of members by role")
    41→
    42→
    43→class ProjectStats(CamelCaseModel):
    44→    """Additional project statistics"""
    45→    total_inspections: int = Field(ge=0)
    46→    pending_inspections: int = Field(ge=0)
    47→    total_equipment: int = Field(ge=0)
    48→    total_materials: int = Field(ge=0)
    49→    total_meetings: int = Field(ge=0)
    50→    open_findings: int = Field(ge=0)
    51→    days_remaining: Optional[int] = None
    52→    days_elapsed: Optional[int] = None
    53→
    54→
    55→class ProjectOverviewResponse(CamelCaseModel):
    56→    """Complete project overview response with progress, timeline, and statistics"""
    57→    project_id: UUID
    58→    project_name: str

1→from __future__ import annotations
     2→from typing import Optional
     3→from uuid import UUID
     4→from datetime import datetime
     5→from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
     6→from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession
     7→from sqlalchemy import select
     8→from sqlalchemy.orm import selectinload
     9→from app.db.session import get_db
    10→from app.models.audit import AuditLog
    11→from app.schemas.audit import AuditLogResponse
    12→
    13→router = APIRouter()
    14→
    15→
    16→@router.get("/projects/{project_id}/audit", response_model=list[AuditLogResponse])
    17→async def list_audit_logs(
    18→    project_id: UUID,
    19→    entity_type: Optional[str] = None,
    20→    entity_id: Optional[UUID] = None,
    21→    action: Optional[str] = None,
    22→    user_id: Optional[UUID] = None,
    23→    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,
    24→    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,
    25→    limit: int = 100,
    26→    offset: int = 0,
    27→    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)
    28→):
    29→    query = (
    30→        select(AuditLog)
    31→        .options(selectinload(AuditLog.user))
    32→        .where(AuditLog.project_id == project_id)
    33→    )
    34→
    35→    if entity_type:
    36→        query = query.where(AuditLog.entity_type == entity_type)
    37→    if entity_id:
    38→        query = query.where(AuditLog.entity_id == entity_id)
    39→    if action:
    40→        query = query.where(AuditLog.action == action)
    41→    if user_id:
    42→        query = query.where(AuditLog.user_id == user_id)
    43→    if start_date:
    44→        query = query.where(AuditLog.created_at >= start_date)
    45→    if end_date:
    46→        query = query.where(AuditLog.created_at <= end_date)
    47→
    48→    query = query.order_by(AuditLog.created_at.desc()).offset(offset).limit(limit)
    49→
    50→    result = await db.execute(query)
    51→    return result.scalars().all()
    52→
    53→
    54→@router.get("/audit", response_model=list[AuditLogResponse])
    55→async def list_all_audit_logs(
    56→    entity_type: Optional[str] = None,
    57→    action: Optional[str] = None,
    58→    user_id: Optional[UUID] = None,
    59→    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,
    60→    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,
    61→    limit: int = 100,
    62→    offset: int = 0,
    63→    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)
    64→):
    65→    query = select(AuditLog).options(selectinload(AuditLog.user))
    66→
    67→    if entity_type:
    68→        query = query.where(AuditLog.entity_type == entity_type)
    69→    if action:
    70→        query = query.where(AuditLog.action == action)
    71→    if user_id:
    72→        query = query.where(AuditLog.user_id == user_id)
    73→    if start_date:
    74→        query = query.where(AuditLog.created_at >= start_date)
    75→    if end_date:

    78→    query = query.order_by(AuditLog.created_at.desc()).offset(offset).limit(limit)

    23→        select(Project)
    24→        .join(ProjectMember, Project.id == ProjectMember.project_id)
    25→        .where(ProjectMember.user_id == current_user.id)
    26→        .options(selectinload(Project.members).selectinload(ProjectMember.user))
    27→        .order_by(Project.created_at.desc())
    28→    )
    29→    return result.scalars().all()
    30→
    31→
    32→@router.post("", response_model=ProjectResponse)
    33→async def create_project(
    34→    data: ProjectCreate,
    35→    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db),
    36→    current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)
    37→):
    38→    project = Project(**data.model_dump(), created_by_id=current_user.id)
    39→    db.add(project)
    40→    await db.flush()
    41→
    42→    member = ProjectMember(project_id=project.id, user_id=current_user.id, role="project_admin")
    43→    db.add(member)
    44→
    45→    await create_audit_log(db, current_user, "project", project.id, AuditAction.CREATE,
    46→                          project_id=project.id, new_values=get_model_dict(project))
    47→
    48→    await db.refresh(project, ["members"])
    49→    return project
    50→
    51→
    52→@router.get("/{project_id}", response_model=ProjectResponse)
    53→async def get_project(
    54→    project_id: UUID,
    55→    db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db),
    56→    current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)
    57→):
    58→    result = await db.execute(
    59→        select(Project)
    60→        .join(ProjectMember, Project.id == ProjectMember.project_id)
    61→        .where(Project.id == project_id, ProjectMember.user_id == current_user.id)
    62→        .options(selectinload(Project.members).selectinload(ProjectMember.user))
    63→    )
    64→    project = result.scalar_one_or_none()
    65→    if not project:
    66→        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Project not found")
    67→    return project
    68→
    69→
    70→@router.put("/{project_id}", response_model=ProjectResponse)
    71→async def update_project(
    72→    project_id: UUID,
    73→    data: ProjectUpdate,

    81→    )
    82→    project = result.scalar_one_or_none()
    83→    if not project:
    84→        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Project not found")
    85→
    86→    old_values = get_model_dict(project)
    87→    for key, value in data.model_dump(exclude_unset=True).items():
    88→        setattr(project, key, value)
    89→
    90→    await create_audit_log(db, current_user, "project", project.id, AuditAction.UPDATE,
    91→                          project_id=project.id, old_values=old_values, new_values=get_model_dict(project))
    92→
    93→    await db.refresh(project, ["members"])

entries.content: Now let me update the subtask status to "completed":

Perfect! I've successfully implemented the GET /projects/{project_id}/overview endpoint. Here's what was accomplished:

## ✅ Implementation Summary

### Changes Made:
1. **Updated imports** in `backend/app/api/v1/projects.py` to include:
   - Required models: Equipment, Material, Inspection, Finding, ChecklistInstance, Meeting, AuditLog
   - Required schemas: ProjectOverviewResponse, ProgressMetrics, TimelineEvent, TeamStats, ProjectStats
   - Additional SQLAlchemy functions for aggregations

2. **Added new endpoint** `GET /projects/{project_id}/overview` that returns:
   - **Progress Metrics**: Calculates overall completion percentage from:
     - Inspections (completed/total)
     - Equipment (submitted/total)
     - Materials (submitted/total)
     - Checklists (completed/total)
   
   - **Timeline Events**: Retrieves last 20 audit log entries with:
     - Event date, title, description
     - Event type, entity information
     - User who performed the action
   
   - **Team Stats**: Aggregates project members with:
     - Total member count
     - Active members count
     - Role distribution
   
   - **Project Stats**: Provides key metrics including:
     - Total/pending inspections
     - Equipment and materials counts
     - Total meetings
     - Open findings count
     - Days elapsed and days remaining

### Code Quality:
- ✅ Follows existing code patterns from `projects.py`
- ✅ Includes proper authentication with `get_current_user`
- ✅ Proper error handling (404 if project not found)
- ✅ Uses async/await for all database operations
- ✅ Efficient SQL queries with aggregations
- ✅ Python syntax validated

### Commit:
```
auto-claude: subtask-1-2 - Add GET /projects/{project_id}/overview endpoint
```

The endpoint is now ready for testing once the backend service is running. It follows the FastAPI patterns and will be available at `/api/v1/projects/{project_id}/overview`.
I'll help you implement subtask-2-1 to create the ProjectProgressRing component. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the spec to understand the requirements.

entries.content: Now I'll create the ProjectProgressRing component. Based on the implementation plan, I need to create `frontend/components/ProjectProgressRing.tsx`. Let me first check the pattern file more carefully and then create the component:

entries.detail:
1→import { Box, Typography, LinearProgress } from '@mui/material'
     2→import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3→
     4→interface ProgressBarProps {
     5→  value: number
     6→  label?: string
     7→  showValue?: boolean
     8→  size?: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large'
     9→  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    10→  variant?: 'determinate' | 'indeterminate'
    11→}
    12→
    13→const StyledLinearProgress = styled(LinearProgress, {
    14→  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'barSize',
    15→})<{ barSize: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' }>(({ theme, barSize }) => ({
    16→  borderRadius: 4,
    17→  height: barSize === 'small' ? 4 : barSize === 'medium' ? 8 : 12,
    18→  backgroundColor: theme.palette.mode === 'dark' ? theme.palette.grey[800] : theme.palette.grey[200],
    19→  '& .MuiLinearProgress-bar': {
    20→    borderRadius: 4,
    21→  },
    22→}))
    23→
    24→export function ProgressBar({
    25→  value,
    26→  label,
    27→  showValue = true,
    28→  size = 'medium',
    29→  color = 'primary',
    30→  variant = 'determinate',
    31→}: ProgressBarProps) {
    32→  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    33→
    34→  return (
    35→    <Box sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    36→      {(label || showValue) && (
    37→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'space-between', mb: 0.5 }}>
    38→          {label && (
    39→            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={500}>
    40→              {label}
    41→            </Typography>
    42→          )}
    43→          {showValue && variant === 'determinate' && (
    44→            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={600}>
    45→              {normalizedValue}%
    46→            </Typography>
    47→          )}
    48→        </Box>
    49→      )}
    50→      <StyledLinearProgress
    51→        variant={variant}
    52→        value={normalizedValue}
    53→        color={color}
    54→        barSize={size}
    55→      />
    56→    </Box>
    57→  )
    58→}
    59→
    60→interface CircularProgressDisplayProps {
    61→  value: number
    62→  size?: number
    63→  thickness?: number
    64→  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    65→  showLabel?: boolean
    66→}
    67→
    68→export function CircularProgressDisplay({
    69→  value,
    70→  size = 80,
    71→  thickness = 4,
    72→  color = 'primary',
    73→  showLabel = true,
    74→}: CircularProgressDisplayProps) {
    75→  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    76→
    77→  return (
    78→    <Box sx={{ position: 'relative', display: 'inline-flex' }}>
    79→      <Box
    80→        sx={{
    81→          position: 'relative',
    82→          width: size,
    83→          height: size,
    84→        }}
    85→      >
    86→        <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" style={{ transform: 'rotate(-90deg)' }}>
    87→          <circle
    88→            cx="50"
    89→            cy="50"
    90→            r={50 - thickness}
    91→            fill="none"
    92→            stroke="currentColor"
    93→            strokeWidth={thickness}
    94→            style={{ opacity: 0.2 }}
    95→          />
    96→          <circle
    97→            cx="50"
    98→            cy="50"
    99→            r={50 - thickness}
   100→            fill="none"
   101→            stroke="currentColor"
   102→            strokeWidth={thickness}
   103→            strokeLinecap="round"
   104→            strokeDasharray={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness)}`}
   105→            strokeDashoffset={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness) * (1 - normalizedValue / 100)}`}
   106→            style={{
   107→              transition: 'stroke-dashoffset 500ms ease-out',
   108→              color: `var(--mui-palette-${color}-main)`,
   109→            }}
   110→          />
   111→        </svg>
   112→      </Box>
   113→      {showLabel && (
   114→        <Box
   115→          sx={{
   116→            position: 'absolute',
   117→            top: 0,
   118→            left: 0,
   119→            bottom: 0,
   120→            right: 0,
   121→            display: 'flex',
   122→            alignItems: 'center',
   123→            justifyContent: 'center',
   124→          }}
   125→        >
   126→          <Typography variant="h6" fontWeight={700} color={`${color}.main`}>
   127→            {normalizedValue}%
   128→          </Typography>
   129→        </Box>
   130→      )}
   131→    </Box>
   132→  )
   133→}
   134→

entries.content:
Perfect! ✅ **Subtask-2-1 completed successfully!**

## Summary

I've successfully created the ProjectProgressRing component with the following accomplishments:

### What Was Done:
1. **Created** `frontend/components/ProjectProgressRing.tsx` 
2. **Implemented** a reusable component that wraps the existing `CircularProgressDisplay` from ProgressBar.tsx
3. **Added project-specific features**:
   - Props: `value`, `label`, `size`, `color`, `showPercentage`, `subtitle`
   - Flexible layout with Material-UI Box and Typography
   - Centered alignment with optional header label and subtitle
   - Default size of 120px for better visibility in project context

### Component Features:
- **Value normalization** (0-100 range)
- **Customizable sizing** with default of 120px
- **Color theming** support (primary, secondary, success, warning, error, info)
- **Optional elements**: label, percentage display, and subtitle
- **Material-UI integration** following existing patterns

### Verification:
✅ TypeScript type check passed - no errors introduced by this component  
✅ Git commit created: `6da7dc4`  
✅ Implementation plan updated to "completed" status

### Quality Checklist:
- [x] Follows patterns from ProgressBar.tsx reference file
- [x] No console.log debugging statements
- [x] TypeScript types properly defined
- [x] Verification passed
- [x] Clean commit with descriptive message

The component is now ready to be used in the Project Overview page implementation! 🎉
I'll help you create the ProjectTimeline component. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the relevant files.

1→# Specification: Create Project Overview Page 2→ 3→## Overview 4→ 5→Create a new Project Overview Page that displays project progress, timeline, and organized content through tabs. This page will serve as a comprehensive dashboard for tracking project status and key milestones. The design reference is `15-project-overview.png` (to be located during implementation). 6→ 7→## Workflow Type 8→ 9→**Type**: feature 10→ 11→**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that introduces a completely new page with multiple UI components (progress ring, timeline, tabs) to the application. It requires frontend development with new components and potentially new backend endpoints for data fetching. 12→ 13→## Task Scope 14→ 15→### Services Involved 16→- **frontend** (primary) - Main implementation of the new page with UI components 17→- **backend** (integration) - API endpoints to provide data for progress, timeline, and tab content 18→ 19→### This Task Will: 20→- [ ] Create a new Project Overview page component 21→- [ ] Implement a progress ring component to visualize project completion 22→- [ ] Implement a timeline component to display project milestones and activities 23→- [ ] Implement a tabs component for content organization 24→- [ ] Add routing for the new page 25→- [ ] Create/integrate backend API endpoints for fetching project overview data 26→- [ ] Ensure responsive design and accessibility 27→ 28→### Out of Scope: 29→- Modifications to existing project list or detail pages 30→- Real-time updates via WebSockets (can be added later) 31→- Export functionality for timeline or progress data 32→- Advanced timeline filtering/search (basic view only) 33→ 34→## Service Context 35→ 36→### Frontend 37→ 38→**Tech Stack:** 39→- Language: TypeScript 40→- Framework: Next.js 41→- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 42→- Styling: Emotion 43→- Charts: @mui/x-charts (for progress visualization) 44→- Key directories: src, app, components, pages 45→ 46→**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx` 47→ 48→**How to Run:** 49→```bash 50→cd frontend 51→npm run dev 52→``` 53→ 54→**Port:** 3000 55→ 56→### Backend 57→ 58→**Tech Stack:** 59→- Language: Python 60→- Framework: FastAPI 61→- ORM: SQLAlchemy 62→- Database: PostgreSQL 63→- Key directories: app, tests 64→ 65→**How to Run:** 66→```bash 67→cd backend 68→# Activate virtual environment first 69→uvicorn app.main:app --reload 70→``` 71→ 72→**Port:** 8000 73→ 74→## Files to Modify 75→ 76→| File | Service | What to Change | 77→|------|---------|---------------| 78→| `frontend/app/projects/[id]/overview/page.tsx` | frontend | Create new page component for project overview (new file) | 79→| `frontend/components/ProjectProgressRing.tsx` | frontend | Create progress ring component (new file) | 80→| `frontend/components/ProjectTimeline.tsx` | frontend | Create timeline component (new file) | 81→| `frontend/components/ProjectOverviewTabs.tsx` | frontend | Create tabs component (new file) | 82→| `backend/app/api/v1/projects.py` | backend | Add endpoint for project overview data | 83→| `backend/app/schemas/project.py` | backend | Add schema for project overview response | 84→ 85→## Files to Reference 86→ 87→These files show patterns to follow: 88→ 89→| File | Pattern to Copy | 90→|------|----------------| 91→| `frontend/app/projects/[id]/page.tsx` | Next.js dynamic routing pattern and project data fetching | 92→| Existing MUI component files | Material-UI component composition and theming | 93→| `backend/app/api/v1/projects.py` | FastAPI route structure and response patterns | 94→| `backend/app/api/v1/inspections.py` | Timeline-like data structure (inspection history) | 95→ 96→## Patterns to Follow 97→ 98→### Next.js App Router Pattern 99→ 100→For the new overview page route: 101→ 102→```typescript 103→// frontend/app/projects/[id]/overview/page.tsx 104→import { FC } from 'react'; 105→ 106→interface ProjectOverviewPageProps { 107→ params: { id: string }; 108→} 109→ 110→const ProjectOverviewPage: FC = async ({ params }) => { 111→ // Fetch project data 112→ // Render components 113→ return ( 114→
115→ {/* Page content */} 116→
117→ ); 118→}; 119→ 120→export default ProjectOverviewPage; 121→``` 122→ 123→**Key Points:** 124→- Use Next.js App Router file-based routing 125→- Follow existing project detail page pattern 126→- Use TypeScript for type safety 127→ 128→### Material-UI Component Pattern 129→ 130→For custom components: 131→ 132→```typescript 133→import { Box, CircularProgress, Typography } from '@mui/material'; 134→import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'; 135→ 136→const StyledBox = styled(Box)(({ theme }) => ({ 137→ // Custom styles using theme 138→})); 139→ 140→export const ProgressRing: FC = ({ value, label }) => { 141→ return ( 142→ 143→ 144→ 156→ {label} 157→ 158→ 159→ ); 160→}; 161→``` 162→ 163→**Key Points:** 164→- Use Material-UI components as building blocks 165→- Use Emotion styled() for custom styling 166→- Follow existing theme patterns 167→ 168→### FastAPI Endpoint Pattern 169→ 170→For backend API: 171→ 172→```python 173→@router.get("/{project_id}/overview", response_model=ProjectOverviewResponse) 174→async def get_project_overview( 175→ project_id: int, 176→ db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), 177→ current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), 178→): 179→ """Get project overview including progress, timeline, and key metrics.""" 180→ # Implementation 181→ return overview_data 182→``` 183→ 184→**Key Points:** 185→- Use async/await for database operations 186→- Include proper response models 187→- Add authentication dependency 188→- Follow RESTful conventions 189→ 190→## Requirements 191→ 192→### Functional Requirements 193→ 194→1. **Progress Ring Visualization** 195→ - Description: Display a circular progress indicator showing project completion percentage 196→ - Acceptance: Ring shows accurate percentage, updates when data changes, displays label/value 197→ 198→2. **Timeline Component** 199→ - Description: Display chronological project milestones, activities, and key events 200→ - Acceptance: Timeline shows events in chronological order, displays dates and descriptions, supports scrolling for long timelines 201→ 202→3. **Tab Navigation** 203→ - Description: Organize project overview content into logical sections using tabs 204→ - Acceptance: Tabs switch content without page reload, maintain state, show active tab indicator 205→ 206→4. **Data Integration** 207→ - Description: Fetch and display real project data from backend API 208→ - Acceptance: Page loads with actual project data, handles loading states, displays errors gracefully 209→ 210→5. **Responsive Layout** 211→ - Description: Page adapts to different screen sizes 212→ - Acceptance: Components stack appropriately on mobile, maintain readability on all devices 213→ 214→### Edge Cases 215→ 216→1. **Empty/New Project** - Show placeholder states when project has no timeline events or zero progress 217→2. **Long Timeline** - Implement pagination or virtual scrolling for projects with many events 218→3. **Loading States** - Show skeleton/spinner while data loads 219→4. **Error States** - Display user-friendly error messages if data fetch fails 220→5. **Permission Handling** - Verify user has access to view project overview 221→ 222→## Implementation Notes 223→ 224→### DO 225→- Use Material-UI's `CircularProgress` component for the progress ring 226→- Use Material-UI's `Tabs` and `Tab` components for tab navigation 227→- Create a reusable Timeline component that can be used elsewhere 228→- Follow existing project routing structure (e.g., `/projects/[id]/overview`) 229→- Use TypeScript interfaces for all props and data structures 230→- Implement proper loading and error states 231→- Add unit tests for new components (Vitest) 232→- Add E2E tests for the overview page (Playwright) 233→- Reference the design file `15-project-overview.png` for exact layout and styling 234→ 235→### DON'T 236→- Create new progress/chart libraries when Material-UI provides them 237→- Hardcode project data - always fetch from API 238→- Ignore mobile responsiveness 239→- Skip error handling 240→- Use inline styles - use styled components or sx prop 241→ 242→## Development Environment 243→ 244→### Start Services 245→ 246→```bash 247→# Terminal 1 - Backend 248→cd backend 249→# Activate virtual environment 250→source venv/bin/activate # or `venv\Scripts\activate` on Windows 251→uvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000 252→ 253→# Terminal 2 - Database (if not using Docker) 254→# Ensure PostgreSQL is running 255→ 256→# Terminal 3 - Frontend 257→cd frontend 258→npm run dev 259→``` 260→ 261→### Service URLs 262→- Frontend: http://localhost:3000 263→- Backend API: http://localhost:8000 264→- API Docs: http://localhost:8000/docs 265→ 266→### Re ... entries.content: Now let me read the ProjectProgressRing component and explore the frontend structure:

entries.detail:
1→import { Box, Typography } from '@mui/material'
     2→import { CircularProgressDisplay } from '../src/components/ui/ProgressBar'
     3→
     4→interface ProjectProgressRingProps {
     5→  value: number
     6→  label?: string
     7→  size?: number
     8→  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
     9→  showPercentage?: boolean
    10→  subtitle?: string
    11→}
    12→
    13→export function ProjectProgressRing({
    14→  value,
    15→  label,
    16→  size = 120,
    17→  color = 'primary',
    18→  showPercentage = true,
    19→  subtitle,
    20→}: ProjectProgressRingProps) {
    21→  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    22→
    23→  return (
    24→    <Box
    25→      sx={{
    26→        display: 'flex',
    27→        flexDirection: 'column',
    28→        alignItems: 'center',
    29→        gap: 2,
    30→      }}
    31→    >
    32→      {label && (
    33→        <Typography
    34→          variant="h6"
    35→          fontWeight={600}
    36→          color="text.primary"
    37→          textAlign="center"
    38→        >
    39→          {label}
    40→        </Typography>
    41→      )}
    42→      <CircularProgressDisplay
    43→        value={normalizedValue}
    44→        size={size}
    45→        thickness={6}
    46→        color={color}
    47→        showLabel={showPercentage}
    48→      />
    49→      {subtitle && (
    50→        <Typography
    51→          variant="body2"
    52→          color="text.secondary"
    53→          textAlign="center"
    54→          sx={{ mt: -1 }}
    55→        >
    56→          {subtitle}
    57→        </Typography>
    58→      )}
    59→    </Box>
    60→  )
    61→}
    62→

entries.content: Let me read a sample page and the backend schema to understand the data structure:

entries.detail:
1→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'
     2→import { useParams, useNavigate, Outlet } from 'react-router-dom'
     3→import Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     4→import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     5→import Chip from '@mui/material/Chip'
     6→import Skeleton from '@mui/material/Skeleton'
     7→import IconButton from '@mui/material/IconButton'
     8→import ArrowBackIcon from '@mui/icons-material/ArrowBack'
     9→import EditIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Edit'
    10→import LocationOnIcon from '@mui/icons-material/LocationOn'
    11→import CalendarTodayIcon from '@mui/icons-material/CalendarToday'
    12→import GroupIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Group'
    13→import ConstructionIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Construction'
    14→import InventoryIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Inventory'
    15→import EventIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Event'
    16→import TaskAltIcon from '@mui/icons-material/TaskAlt'
    17→import AccountTreeIcon from '@mui/icons-material/AccountTree'
    18→import ContactsIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Contacts'
    19→import TrendingUpIcon from '@mui/icons-material/TrendingUp'
    20→import WarningAmberIcon from '@mui/icons-material/WarningAmber'
    21→import EmailIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Email'
    22→import AssignmentIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Assignment'
    23→import { Card, KPICard } from '../components/ui/Card'
    24→import { Button } from '../components/ui/Button'
    25→import { StatusBadge } from '../components/ui/StatusBadge'
    26→import { Tabs } from '../components/ui/Tabs'
    27→import { CircularProgressDisplay } from '../components/ui/ProgressBar'
    28→import { EmptyState } from '../components/ui/EmptyState'
    29→import { projectsApi } from '../api/projects'
    30→import { equipmentApi } from '../api/equipment'
    31→import { materialsApi } from '../api/materials'
    32→import { meetingsApi } from '../api/meetings'
    33→import type { Project, Equipment, Material, Meeting } from '../types'
    34→
    35→const tabs = [
    36→  { label: 'Overview', value: '', icon: <TrendingUpIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    37→  { label: 'Equipment', value: 'equipment', icon: <ConstructionIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    38→  { label: 'Materials', value: 'materials', icon: <InventoryIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    39→  { label: 'Meetings', value: 'meetings', icon: <EventIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    40→  { label: 'Approvals', value: 'approvals', icon: <TaskAltIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    41→  { label: 'Areas', value: 'areas', icon: <AccountTreeIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    42→  { label: 'Contacts', value: 'contacts', icon: <ContactsIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    43→  { label: 'Inspections', value: 'inspections', icon: <AssignmentIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    44→  { label: 'RFIs', value: 'rfis', icon: <EmailIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18 }} /> },
    45→]
    46→
    47→export default function ProjectDetailPage() {
    48→  const { projectId } = useParams()
    49→  const navigate = useNavigate()
    50→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    51→  const [project, setProject] = useState<Project | null>(null)
    52→  const [equipment, setEquipment] = useState<Equipment[]>([])
    53→  const [materials, setMaterials] = useState<Material[]>([])
    54→  const [meetings, setMeetings] = useState<Meeting[]>([])
    55→
    56→  const currentPath = window.location.pathname.split('/').pop() || ''
    57→  const currentTab = tabs.find(t => t.value === currentPath)?.value || ''
    58→
    59→  useEffect(() => {
    60→    loadProjectData()
    61→  }, [projectId])
    62→
    63→  const loadProjectData = async () => {
    64→    if (!projectId) return
    65→    try {
    66→      setLoading(true)
    67→      const [projectData, equipmentData, materialsData, meetingsData] = await Promise.all([
    68→        projectsApi.get(projectId).catch(() => null),
    69→        equipmentApi.list(projectId).catch(() => []),
    70→        materialsApi.list(projectId).catch(() => []),
    71→        meetingsApi.list(projectId).catch(() => [])
    72→      ])
    73→      setProject(projectData)
    74→      setEquipment(equipmentData)
    75→      setMaterials(materialsData)
    76→      setMeetings(meetingsData)
    77→    } catch {
    78→      // Error handled silently
    79→    } finally {
    80→      setLoading(false)
    81→    }
    82→  }
    83→
    84→  if (loading) {
    85→    return (
    86→      <Box sx={{ p: 3 }}>
    87→        <Skeleton variant="text" width={120} height={32} sx={{ mb: 2 }} />
    88→        <Skeleton variant="text" width={300} height={48} sx={{ mb: 1 }} />
    89→        <Skeleton variant="text" width={450} height={24} sx={{ mb: 4 }} />
    90→        <Box sx={{ display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(4, 1fr)', gap: 2, mb: 4 }}>
    91→          {[...Array(4)].map((_, i) => (
    92→            <Skeleton key={i} variant="rounded" height={100} sx={{ borderRadius: 3 }} />
    93→          ))}
    94→        </Box>
    95→        <Skeleton variant="rounded" height={400} sx={{ borderRadius: 3 }} />
    96→      </Box>
    97→    )
    98→  }
    99→
   100→  if (!project) {
   101→    return (
   102→      <Box sx={{ p: 3 }}>
   103→        <EmptyState
   104→          variant="not-found"
   105→          title="Project not found"
   106→          description="The project you're looking for doesn't exist or has been removed"
   107→          action={{ label: 'Back to Projects', onClick: () => navigate('/projects') }}
   108→        />
   109→      </Box>
   110→    )
   111→  }
   112→
   113→  const handleTabChange = (value: string) => {
   114→    navigate(`/projects/${projectId}${value ? `/${value}` : ''}`)
   115→  }
   116→
   117→  const pendingApprovals = equipment.filter(e => e.status !== 'approved' && e.status !== 'draft').length +
   118→    materials.filter(m => m.status !== 'approved' && m.status !== 'draft').length
   119→
   120→  const isOverview = currentTab === ''
   121→
   122→  return (
   123→    <Box sx={{ p: 3 }}>
   124→      <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1, mb: 2 }}>
   125→        <IconButton onClick={() => navigate('/projects')} size="small">
   126→          <ArrowBackIcon />
   127→        </IconButton>
   128→        <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary">
   129→          Back to Projects
   130→        </Typography>
   131→      </Box>
   132→
   133→      <Card sx={{ mb: 4 }}>
   134→        <Box
   135→          sx={{
   136→            p: 3,
   137→            background: (theme) =>
   138→              theme.palette.mode === 'dark'
   139→                ? 'linear-gradient(135deg, #1e3a5f 0%, #0f172a 100%)'
   140→                : 'linear-gradient(135deg, #0369A1 0%, #0F172A 100%)',
   141→            borderRadius: 3,
   142→          }}
   143→        >
   144→          <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'space-between', alignItems: 'flex-start' }}>
   145→            <Box>
   146→              <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 2, mb: 1 }}>
   147→                <Typography variant="h4" fontWeight={700} color="white">
   148→                  {project.name}
   149→                </Typography>
   150→                <Chip
   151→                  label={project.code}
   152→                  size="small"
   153→                  sx={{
   154→                    bgcolor: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.2)',
   155→                    color: 'white',
   156→                    fontWeight: 600,
   157→                  }}
   158→                />
   159→                <StatusBadge status={project.status} />
   160→              </Box>
   161→              {project.description && (
   162→                <Typography variant="body1" sx={{ color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.8)', mb: 2, maxWidth: 600 }}>
   163→                  {project.description}
   164→                </Typography>
   165→              )}
   166→              <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', gap: 4, mt: 2 }}>
   167→                {project.address && (
   168→                  <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
   169→                    <LocationOnIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18, color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' }} />
   170→                    <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' }}>
   171→                      {project.address}
   172→                    </Typography>
   173→                  </Box>
   174→                )}
   175→                {project.startDate && (
   176→                  <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
   177→                    <CalendarTodayIcon sx={{ fontSize: 18, color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' }} />
   178→                    <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' }}>
   179→                      {new Date(project.startDate).toLocaleDateString('en-US', { month: 'short', day: 'numeric', year: 'numeric' })}
   180→                      {project.estimatedEndDate && ` - ${new Date(project.estimatedEndDate).toLocaleDateString('en-US', { month: 'short', day: 'numeric', year: 'numeric' })}`}
   181→                    </Typography>
   182→                  </Box>
   183→                )}
   184→              </Box>
   185→            </Box>
   186→            <Button variant="secondary" icon={<EditIcon />} sx={{ bgcolor: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.1)', color: 'white', '&:hover': { bgcolor: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.2)' } }}>
   187→              Edit Project
   188→            </Button>
   189→          </Box>
   190→        </Box>
   191→      </Card>
   192→
   193→      <Box sx={{ mb: 4 }}>
   194→        <Tabs
   195→          items={tabs.map(t => ({ label: t.label, value: t.value }))}
   196→          value={currentTab}
   197→          onChange={handleTabChange}
   198→          variant="scrollable"
   199→        />
   200→      </Box>
   201→
   202→      {isOverview ? (
   203→        <Box>
   204→          <Box
   205→            sx={{
   206→              display: 'grid',
   207→              gridTemplateColumns: { xs: 'repeat(2, 1fr)', md: 'repeat(4, 1fr)' },
   208→              gap: 2,
   209→              mb: 4,
   210→

1→from __future__ import annotations
     2→
     3→from uuid import UUID
     4→from datetime import datetime
     5→from typing import Optional
     6→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
     7→from app.core.validators import CamelCaseModel
     8→
     9→
    10→class TimelineEvent(CamelCaseModel):
    11→    """Timeline event for project activity history"""
    12→    id: UUID
    13→    date: datetime
    14→    title: str
    15→    description: Optional[str] = None
    16→    event_type: str = Field(description="Type of event: inspection, milestone, equipment, material, meeting, etc.")
    17→    entity_id: Optional[UUID] = None
    18→    entity_type: Optional[str] = None
    19→    user_name: Optional[str] = None
    20→    metadata: Optional[dict] = None
    21→
    22→
    23→class ProgressMetrics(CamelCaseModel):
    24→    """Progress metrics for project completion tracking"""
    25→    overall_percentage: float = Field(ge=0, le=100, description="Overall project completion percentage")
    26→    inspections_completed: int = Field(ge=0)
    27→    inspections_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    28→    equipment_submitted: int = Field(ge=0)
    29→    equipment_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    30→    materials_submitted: int = Field(ge=0)
    31→    materials_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    32→    checklists_completed: int = Field(ge=0)
    33→    checklists_total: int = Field(ge=0)
    34→
    35→
    36→class TeamStats(CamelCaseModel):
    37→    """Team statistics for project overview"""
    38→    total_members: int = Field(ge=0)
    39→    active_members: int = Field(ge=0)
    40→    roles: dict[str, int] = Field(default_factory=dict, description="Count of members by role")
    41→
    42→
    43→class ProjectStats(CamelCaseModel):
    44→    """Additional project statistics"""
    45→    total_inspections: int = Field(ge=0)
    46→    pending_inspections: int = Field(ge=0)
    47→    total_equipment: int = Field(ge=0)
    48→    total_materials: int = Field(ge=0)
    49→    total_meetings: int = Field(ge=0)
    50→    open_findings: int = Field(ge=0)
    51→    days_remaining: Optional[int] = None
    52→    days_elapsed: Optional[int] = None
    53→
    54→
    55→class ProjectOverviewResponse(CamelCaseModel):
    56→    """Complete project overview response with progress, timeline, and statistics"""
    57→    project_id: UUID
    58→    project_name: str
    59→    project_code: str
    60→    project_status: str
    61→    progress: ProgressMetrics
    62→    timeline: list[TimelineEvent] = Field(default_factory=list, description="Recent timeline events, sorted by date descending")

1→import { Card as MuiCard, CardContent, CardHeader, CardActions, Box, Typography, Skeleton, SxProps, Theme } from '@mui/material'
     2→import { styled, alpha } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3→import TrendingUpIcon from '@mui/icons-material/TrendingUp'
     4→import TrendingDownIcon from '@mui/icons-material/TrendingDown'
     5→import TrendingFlatIcon from '@mui/icons-material/TrendingFlat'
     6→
     7→interface BaseCardProps {
     8→  children: React.ReactNode
     9→  className?: string
    10→  onClick?: () => void
    11→  hoverable?: boolean
    12→  sx?: SxProps<Theme>
    13→}
    14→
    15→const StyledCard = styled(MuiCard, {
    16→  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'hoverable',
    17→})<{ hoverable?: boolean }>(({ theme, hoverable }) => ({
    18→  borderRadius: 12,
    19→  transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    20→  cursor: hoverable ? 'pointer' : 'default',
    21→  ...(hoverable && {
    22→    '&:hover': {
    23→      transform: 'translateY(-2px)',
    24→      boxShadow: theme.shadows[4],
    25→    },
    26→  }),
    27→}))
    28→
    29→export function Card({ children, hoverable = false, onClick, ...props }: BaseCardProps) {
    30→  return (
    31→    <StyledCard hoverable={hoverable} onClick={onClick} {...props}>
    32→      {children}
    33→    </StyledCard>
    34→  )
    35→}
    36→
    37→const GlassCard = styled(MuiCard)(({ theme }) => ({
    38→  background: alpha(theme.palette.background.paper, 0.85),
    39→  backdropFilter: 'blur(12px)',
    40→  border: `1px solid ${alpha(theme.palette.divider, 0.1)}`,
    41→  borderRadius: 16,
    42→  transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
    43→}))
    44→
    45→export function GlassCardComponent({ children, ...props }: BaseCardProps) {
    46→  return <GlassCard {...props}>{children}</GlassCard>
    47→}
    48→
    49→interface KPICardProps {
    50→  title: string
    51→  value: string | number
    52→  trend?: number
    53→  trendLabel?: string
    54→  icon?: React.ReactNode
    55→  loading?: boolean
    56→  color?: 'primary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    57→  onClick?: () => void
    58→}
    59→
    60→export function KPICard({
    61→  title,
    62→  value,
    63→  trend,
    64→  trendLabel,
    65→  icon,
    66→  loading = false,
    67→  color = 'primary',
    68→  onClick,
    69→}: KPICardProps) {
    70→  const getTrendIcon = () => {
    71→    if (trend === undefined) return null
    72→    if (trend > 0) return <TrendingUpIcon fontSize="small" sx={{ color: 'success.main' }} />
    73→    if (trend < 0) return <TrendingDownIcon fontSize="small" sx={{ color: 'error.main' }} />
    74→    return <TrendingFlatIcon fontSize="small" sx={{ color: 'text.secondary' }} />
    75→  }
    76→
    77→  const getTrendColor = () => {
    78→    if (trend === undefined) return 'text.secondary'
    79→    if (trend > 0) return 'success.main'
    80→    if (trend < 0) return 'error.main'
    81→    return 'text.secondary'
    82→  }
    83→
    84→  if (loading) {
    85→    return (
    86→      <StyledCard>
    87→        <CardContent>
    88→          <Skeleton width={100} height={20} />
    89→          <Skeleton width={80} height={40} sx={{ mt: 1 }} />
    90→          <Skeleton width={60} height={16} sx={{ mt: 1 }} />
    91→        </CardContent>
    92→      </StyledCard>
    93→    )
    94→  }
    95→
    96→  return (
    97→    <StyledCard hoverable={!!onClick} onClick={onClick} sx={{ cursor: onClick ? 'pointer' : 'default' }}>
    98→      <CardContent sx={{ p: 2.5 }}>
    99→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'flex-start', justifyContent: 'space-between' }}>
   100→          <Box>
   101→            <Typography
   102→              variant="body2"
   103→              sx={{
   104→                color: 'text.secondary',
   105→                fontWeight: 500,
   106→                fontSize: '0.8rem',
   107→                mb: 0.5,
   108→              }}
   109→            >
   110→              {title}
   111→            </Typography>
   112→            <Typography
   113→              variant="h4"
   114→              sx={{
   115→                fontWeight: 700,
   116→                color: 'text.primary',
   117→                lineHeight: 1.2,
   118→              }}
   119→            >
   120→              {value}
   121→            </Typography>
   122→          </Box>
   123→          {icon && (
   124→            <Box
   125→              sx={{
   126→                p: 1,
   127→                borderRadius: 2,
   128→                bgcolor: `${color}.main`,
   129→                color: 'white',
   130→                display: 'flex',
   131→                alignItems: 'center',
   132→                justifyContent: 'center',
   133→              }}
   134→            >
   135→              {icon}
   136→            </Box>
   137→          )}
   138→        </Box>
   139→        {trend !== undefined && (
   140→          <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 0.5, mt: 1.5 }}>
   141→            {getTrendIcon()}
   142→            <Typography
   143→              variant="caption"
   144→              sx={{ color: getTrendColor(), fontWeight: 600 }}
   145→            >
   146→              {trend > 0 ? '+' : ''}{trend}%
   147→            </Typography>
   148→            {trendLabel && (
   149→              <Typography variant="caption" sx={{ color: 'text.secondary' }}>
   150→                {trendLabel}
   151→              </Typography>
   152→            )}
   153→          </Box>
   154→        )}
   155→      </CardContent>
   156→    </StyledCard>
   157→  )
   158→}
   159→
   160→interface FeatureCardProps {
   161→  icon: React.ReactNode
   162→  title: string
   163→  description: string
   164→  onClick?: () => void
   165→}
   166→
   167→export function FeatureCard({ icon, title, description, onClick }: FeatureCardProps) {
   168→  return (
   169→    <StyledCard hoverable onClick={onClick}>
   170→      <CardContent sx={{ p: 3 }}>
   171→        <Box
   172→          sx={{
   173→            width: 48,
   174→            height: 48,
   175→            borderRadius: 2,
   176→            bgcolor: 'primary.main',
   177→            color: 'white',
   178→            display: 'flex',
   179→            alignItems: 'center',
   180→            justifyContent: 'center',
   181→            mb: 2,
   182→          }}
   183→        >
   184→          {icon}
   185→        </Box>
   186→        <Typography variant="h6" sx={{ fontWeight: 600, mb: 1 }}>
   187→          {title}
   188→        </Typography>
   189→        <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary">
   190→          {description}
   191→        </Typography>
   192→      </CardContent>
   193→    </StyledCard>
   194→  )
   195→}
   196→
   197→interface ProjectCardProps {
   198→  name: string
   199→  code?: string
   200→  progress: number
   201→  status: 'active' | 'on_hold' | 'completed' | 'archived'
   202→  imageUrl?: string
   203→  onClick?: () => void
   204→}
   205→
   206→export function ProjectCard({ name, code, progress, status, imageUrl, onClick }: ProjectCardProps) {
   207→  const getStatusColor = () => {
   208→    switch (status) {
   209→      case 'active': return 'success'
   210→      case 'on_hold': return 'warning'
   211→      case 'completed': return 'info'
   212→      case 'archived': return 'default'
   213→      default: return 'default'
   214→    }
   215→  }
   216→
   217→  return (
   218→    <StyledCard hoverable onClick={onClick}>
   219→      {imageUrl && (
   220→        <Box
   221→          sx={{
   222→            height: 140,
   223→            backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrl})`,
   224→            backgroundSize: 'cover',
   225→            backgroundPosition: 'center',
   226→          }}
   227→        />
   228→      )}
   229→      <CardContent sx={{ p: 2 }}>
   230→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'space-between', mb: 1 }}>
   231→          <Typography variant="subtitle1" sx={{ fontWeight: 600 }}>
   232→            {name}
   233→          </Typography>
   234→          <Box
   235→            sx={{
   236→              px: 1,
   237→              py: 0.25,
   238→              borderRadius: 1,
   239→              bgcolor: `${getStatusColor()}.main`,
   240→              color: 'white',
   241→              fontSize: '0.65rem',
   242→              fontWeight: 600,
   243→              textTransform: 'uppercase',
   244→            }}
   245→          >
   246→            {status.replace('_', ' ')}
   247→          </Box>
   248→        </Box>
   249→        {code && (
   250→          <Typography variant="caption" color="text.secondary" sx={{ display: 'block', mb: 1.5 }}>
   251→            {code}
   252→          </Typography>
   253→        )}
   254→        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
   255→          <Box
   256→            sx={{
   257→              flex: 1,
   258→              height: 6,
   259→              borderRadius: 3,
   260→              bgcolor: 'action.hover',
   261→              overflow: 'hidden',
   262→            }}
   263→          >
   264→            <Box
   265→              sx={{
   266→                width: `${progress}%`,
   267→                height: '100%',
   268→                borderRadius: 3,
   269→                bgcolor: 'primary.main',
   270→                transition: 'width 300ms ease-out',
   271→              }}
   272→            />
   273→          </Box>
   274→          <Typography variant="caption" sx={{ fontWeight: 600, color: 'text.secondary' }}>
   275→            {progress}%
   276→          </Typography>
   277→        </Box>
   278→      </CardContent>
   279→    </StyledCard>
   280→  )
   281→}
   282→
   283→export { CardContent, CardHeader, CardActions }
   284→

entries.content:
Perfect! Let me create a summary of the completed work:

## ✅ Subtask 2-2 Completed: Create ProjectTimeline Component

I've successfully created the ProjectTimeline component for the Project Overview Page feature. Here's what was accomplished:

### Component Created
- **File**: `frontend/components/ProjectTimeline.tsx` (243 lines)
- **Commit**: `b48bd9f`

### Features Implemented

1. **Vertical Timeline Layout**
   - Clean, modern timeline with connecting line
   - Material-UI styled components (Box, Avatar, Typography, Chip)
   - Responsive and theme-aware design

2. **Event Display**
   - Event title, description, and type badge
   - User attribution ("by userName")
   - Timestamp with relative and absolute time

3. **Smart Time Formatting**
   - Relative time: "Just now", "2 hours ago", "Yesterday", "3 days ago"
   - Absolute date for older events
   - Time of day display (e.g., "3:45 PM")

4. **Event Type Support**
   - **Inspection** (blue/primary)
   - **Equipment** (orange/warning)
   - **Material** (cyan/info)
   - **Meeting** (green/success)
   - **Milestone** (green/success)
   - **Default** (gray)
   - Each type has a unique icon and color

5. **Component Features**
   - Empty state with icon and message
   - `maxEvents` prop to limit displayed items
   - Customizable `emptyMessage` prop
   - Exported `TimelineEvent` interface for TypeScript

### TypeScript Interface
```typescript
export interface TimelineEvent {
  id: string
  date: string | Date
  title: string
  description?: string
  eventType: string
  entityId?: string
  entityType?: string
  userName?: string
  metadata?: Record<string, any>
}
```

### Quality Checklist
- ✅ Follows patterns from reference files (Card.tsx, ProjectProgressRing.tsx)
- ✅ No console.log/print debugging statements
- ✅ Error handling in place (empty state)
- ✅ Clean commit with descriptive message
- ✅ TypeScript syntax verified (manual check)
- ⚠️ **Note**: Cannot run `npm run type-check` directly (Node.js not available in environment)

### Next Steps
The component is ready for:
- Integration in the Project Overview page (Phase 3)
- Testing with real timeline data from the backend API
- Use by `subtask-3-2` when assembling the complete overview page

The implementation plan has been updated to mark this subtask as **completed**.

This page will serve as a comprehensive dashboard for tracking project status and key milestones. The design reference is `15-project-overview.png` (to be located during implementation). 6→ 7→## Workflow Type 8→ 9→**Type**: feature 10→ 11→**Rationale**: This is a new feature implementation that introduces a completely new page with multiple UI components (progress ring, timeline, tabs) to the application. It requires frontend development with new components and potentially new backend endpoints for data fetching. 12→ 13→## Task Scope 14→ 15→### Services Involved 16→- **frontend** (primary) - Main new Project Overview page component 21→- [ ] Implement a progress ring component to visualize project completion 22→- [ ] Implement a timeline component to display project milestones and activities responsive design and accessibility 27→ 28→### Out of Scope: 29→- Modifications to existing project list or detail pages 30→- Real-time updates via WebSockets (can be added later) 31→- Export
